Edouard Ettedgui, Group Chief Executive;
Stuart Dickie, Chief Financial Officer;
Michael Hobson, Sales and Marketing Director;
Terry Stinson, Development Director and President, The Americas | industry = [[Hospitality]], [[tourism]] | products = [[Hotel]] | revenue = {{US$|404 million}} (2006) | operating_income = {{US$|122 million}} (2006) | net_income = {{US$|80 million}} (2006) | num_employees = | parent = [[Jardine Matheson]] | subsid = | homepage = [http://www.mandarinoriental.com www.MandarinOriental.com] | footnotes = }} '''Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group (MOHG)''', a member of the [[Jardine Matheson Holdings Limited|Jardine Matheson Group]], is an international [[hotel]] investment and [[hotel chain|management]] group with luxury hotels, resorts and residences in Asia, Europe and the Americas.{{cite web | title=Corporate Information Press Kit | url=http://mandarinoriental.com/about_mo/media/press_kits/corporate/mohg.aspx | publisher=Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-01-20}} The group has received awards for its service and management, as well as for the spas and restaurants located at many of their hotels and resorts.{{cite web | title=Awards and Accolades | url=http://mandarinoriental.com/about_mo/awards | publisher=Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-01-20}}/ ==History== The Group began with the opening of its flagship property, [[Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong|The Mandarin]], in Hong Kong in 1963, which soon built up a reputation for luxurious service. In 1974, Mandarin International Hotels Limited was formed as a hotel management company. The Group's intention was to "expand into Asia and operate hotels that would reflect the standard of service synonymous with [their] property in [[Hong Kong]]." In 1974 the company's hotel interests expanded further through the acquisition of a 49% interest in [[Mandarin Oriental Hotel, Bangkok|The Oriental, Bangkok]]. The Oriental, built in 1876, was already a legendary property and acknowledged as one of the world's great hotels. Through the management of both The Mandarin in Hong Kong and The Oriental, Bangkok, the Group was in an unusual position of having two "flagship" hotels whose names were among the best in hospitality. In 1985, the Company rationalized its corporate structure by combining these two properties under a common name, Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group. In 1987, Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group was floated on The [[Stock Exchange of Hong Kong]] under the name of "Mandarin Oriental International Limited." Mandarin Oriental International Limited, is incorporated in Bermuda, and listed in London, Singapore and Bermuda. Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group Limited, which operates from Hong Kong, manages the activities of the Groupâs hotels. Today, Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group operates, or has under development, 41 hotels representing over 10,000 rooms in 27 countries, with 18 hotels in Asia, 12 in The Americas and 12 in Europe and North Africa. In addition, the Group operates, or has under development, 13 Residences at Mandarin Oriental, connected to the Groupâs properties. ==Hotels== Currently Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group operates hotels in [[Hong Kong]] (3), [[Bangkok]], [[Tokyo]], [[Manila]], [[Jakarta]], [[Macau]] (2), [[Singapore]], [[Kuala Lumpur]], [[Chiang Mai]], [[Sanya]], [[London]], [[Paris]], [[Munich]], [[Geneva]], [[Prague]], [[Barcelona]], [[Manhattan|New York]], [[Las Vegas Strip|Las Vegas]], [[San Francisco]], [[Washington D.C.]], [[Miami]], [[Boston]], [[Riviera Maya]] and [[Bermuda]].{{cite web | title=Award-winning Hotels & Resorts in Asia, Europe & The Americas: | url=http://www.mandarinoriental.com/our_hotels/ | publisher=Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-01-20}} ===Mandarin Oriental, Bangkok=== {{main|Mandarin Oriental, Bangkok}} [[Mandarin Oriental, Bangkok]] is a five-star hotel in [[Bangkok]], located on the banks of the [[Chao Phraya River]]. The original structure was the first hotel built in [[Thailand]] when it opened The Oriental in 1879. Today, the hotel is one of two flagship properties of Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group and is well-known for its world-class service, which consistently places it among the world's best hotels.{{cite web | title=Mandarin Oriental, Bangkok - Overview |url=http://www.mandarinoriental.com/about_mo/media/press_kits/bangkok/bangkok_overview.aspx | publisher=Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-01-20}} ===Mandarin Oriental, Barcelona=== Mandarin Oriental, Barcelona opened its doors on November 26, 2009. [[Passeig de GrÃ cia, Barcelona|Passeig de GrÃ¡cia]], on which the hotel is situated, is recognized as the most important street in the city of [[Barcelona]] and is often compared to New Yorkâs [[Fifth Avenue]], Londonâs [[Bond Street]], [[Rue du Faubourg Saint-HonorÃ©]] in Paris and [[Via Veneto]] in Rome.{{cite web | title=Mandarin Oriental, Barcelona - Fact Sheet | url=http://www.mandarinoriental.com/about_mo/media/press_kits/barcelona/factsheet.aspx | publisher=Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-01-20}} Previously the location of the Barcelona head office of the Banco Hispanico Americano, the avant-garde luxury hotel today features 98 guestrooms and suites, a {{convert|1000|m2|abbr=on}} spa and fitness center with an indoor lap pool, the signature restaurant ''Moments'', rooftop terrace with a dipping pool, and spacious private function rooms.{{cite web | title=Mandarin Oriental, Barcelona - Did You Know | url=http://www.mandarinoriental.com/about_mo/media/press_kits/barcelona/didyouknow.aspx | publisher=Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-01-20}} ===Mandarin Oriental, Boston=== Among the newest additions to the hotel group is Mandarin Oriental, Boston, located on [[Boylston Street]] in the upscale [[Back Bay]] neighborhood. Open in October 2008, the Forbes five star and AAA five-diamond hotel features 136 guestrooms and 12 suites, the signature Asana restaurant (Forbes Four Star Restaurant){{cite web | title=Forbes Travel Guide - Four Star Restaurants | url=http://www.forbestravelguide.com/four-star-restaurants.htm | publisher=Forbes Travel Guide | year=2011 | accessdate=2011-03-24}} and the M Bar & Lounge. In addition to the guestrooms and suites, the hotel operates 50 upscale condominiums and 35 apartments, each with access to such hotel amenities as housekeeping, in-room dining, concierge and the {{convert|16000|sqft|m2|abbr=on}}, [[Mobil Guide|Forbes Five-Star]] Spa & Fitness Center.{{cite web | title=Mandarin Oriental, Boston - Fact Sheet | url=http://www.mandarinoriental.com/about_mo/media/press_kits/boston/factsheet.aspx | publisher=Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-01-20}} ===Landmark Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong=== [[File:Mandarin Oriental Hong Kong Exterior.jpg|thumb|[[Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong]]]] Located in [[The Landmark (Hong Kong)|The Landmark]] office and shopping development in Hong Kong, The Landmark Mandarin Oriental is a [[Mobil Guide|Forbes Five-Star]] hotel with 113 of the largest guestrooms and suites in Hong Kong with an average size of {{convert|540|sqft|m2|abbr=on}}. In addition to the rooms, the hotel operates the {{convert|25000|sqft|m2|abbr=on}}, [[Mobil Guide|Forbes Five-Star]] Oriental Spa, the MObar and the [[Michelin Guide|Michelin two-starred]] Amber restaurant.{{cite web | title=The Landmark Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong | url=http://www.mandarinoriental.com/about_mo/media/press_kits/landmark/landmark.aspx | publisher=Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-01-20}} ===Mandarin Oriental, Jakarta=== Located at Jakarta's main roundabout, exactly just opposite the [[Grand Hyatt]] and beside the [[Kempinski]] & [[JAL Hotels|Nikko]], with 272 rooms. ===Mandarin Oriental, Las Vegas=== {{main|Mandarin Oriental, Las Vegas}} [[Mandarin Oriental, Las Vegas]], open December 4, 2009, is Mandarin Oriental Hotel Groupâs newest property in North America. Located on the [[Las Vegas Strip]], at the entrance to [[CityCenter]], the 47-story, non-gaming hotel features 392 guestrooms and suites, a {{convert|27000|sqft|m2|abbr=on}} spa and fitness center, and {{convert|12000|sqft|m2|abbr=on}} of function space. Also located on property are the signature restaurant, Twist by [[Pierre Gagnaire]], MOzen Bistro, the Tea Lounge, and Poolside CafÃ© adjacent to the outdoor pool. ===Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park, London=== {{main|Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park, London}} [[Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park, London]] is located on [[Hyde Park, London|Hyde Park]] in [[Knightsbridge]], opposite [[Harvey Nichols]] department store. Originally opened as The Hyde Park Hotel in 1902, Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group purchased the property in 1996 and re-opened it as the Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park, London in 2000. Today, the hotel contains 198 rooms and suites, and operates an award winning spa and the [[Michelin Guide|Michelin-Star]] restaurant, Foliage.{{cite web|url=http://mandarinoriental.com/about_mo/media/press_kits/london/hyde_park.aspx |title=Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park, London |publisher=Mandarinoriental.com |date=2011-06-23 |accessdate=2011-08-10}} ===Grand Lapa Hotel, Macau=== Grand Lapa Hotel, Macau is a five-star hotel operated by Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group.[http://www.mandarinoriental.com/grandlapa/ Grand Lapa Official Website] ===Mandarin Oriental, Miami=== {{main|Mandarin Oriental, Miami}} Mandarin Oriental Hotel Groupâs property in [[Miami]] is located on [[Brickell Key]], a {{convert|44|acre|abbr=on}} island in [[Biscayne Bay]], and operates 326 guestrooms and suites with views of the Atlantic Ocean, Biscayne Bay and the Miami skyline. The hotel also features the Azul and CafÃ© Sambal restaurants, a martini bar, private beach and the only [[Mobil Guide|Forbes Five-Star]] spa in the state of Florida.{{cite web|url=http://www.mandarinoriental.com/about_mo/media/press_kits/miami/overview.aspx |title=Overview |publisher=Mandarinoriental.com |date=2011-06-23 |accessdate=2011-08-10}} ===Mandarin Oriental, New York=== [[File:Mandarin Oriental New York Asiate restaurant view.jpg|thumb|Asiate restaurant at [[Mandarin Oriental, New York]] overlooking [[Central Park]]]] {{main|Mandarin Oriental, New York}} [[Mandarin Oriental, New York]] is a [[Mobil Guide|Forbes Five-Star]] located in the [[Time Warner Center]] at [[Columbus Circle]] in [[Manhattan]]. Set more than {{convert|280|ft|m}} above ground in the north tower, the hotel's 202 guestrooms and 46 suites all have unique views of [[Central Park]], the [[Hudson River]] and New York City's [[Upper West Side]]. The hotel operates Asiate restaurant, the Lobby Lounge, MObar and one of only two [[Mobil Guide|Forbes Five-Star]] spas in New York.{{cite web|url=http://mandarinoriental.com/about_mo/media/press_kits/new_york/fact_sheet.aspx |title=Hotel Fact Sheet |publisher=Mandarinoriental.com |date=2011-06-23 |accessdate=2011-08-10}} ===Mandarin Oriental, Paris=== {{main|Mandarin Oriental, Paris}} Mandarin Oriental, Paris is a luxury hotel in Paris. The 138-room hotel opened in June 2011 in a restored Art Deco government ministry building and is, to date, the most recent addition to the Mandarin Oriental Hotel Groupâs portfolio of managed hotels. The hotel has 4 restaurants and bars â including two establishments by Michelin star winning chef Thierry Marx â as well as The Spa at Mandarin Oriental, Paris. ===Mandarin Oriental, San Francisco=== {{main|Mandarin Oriental, San Francisco}} Mandarin Oriental, San Francisco occupies the top 11 floors of 48 [[Storey|story]] [[345 California Center]] office in the [[Financial District (San Francisco)|financial district]] of [[San Francisco]], [[California]]. The twin towers of 151 room hotel are situated at 45 degree [[angles]] relative to the rest of the building with two glassy [[skybridge]]s that offer views of the [[San Francisco Bay Area]].{{cite web | author= | title=Mandarin Oriental, San Francisco at a Glance | url=http://www.mandarinoriental.com/sanfrancisco/ | publisher=Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group | date=2010 | accessdate=1 September 2010}} ===Mandarin Oriental, Sanya=== The group's first property in Mainland China, Mandarin Oriental, Sanya is located in [[Hainan]], China's southernmost island province. Opened in January 2009, the 12 hectares resort operates 297 guestrooms, suites and villas. The hotel features 5 restaurants, 4 bars, 3 landscaped outdoor swimming pools and a 3,200-square metre Spa Village.http://www.mandarinoriental.com/about_mo/media/press_kits/sanya/factsheet.aspx ===Mandarin Oriental, Singapore=== {{main|Mandarin Oriental Singapore}} Mandarin Oriental, Singapore is one of Mandarin Oriental Hotel Groupâs largest hotels with 527 guestrooms and suites. The property is located in [[Marina Centre]] adjacent to Marina Shopping Mall and within walking distance to [[Suntec City Mall|Suntec City]]. The hotel features five restaurants, two bars, a spa, fitness center, grand ballroom and thirteen individual meeting rooms. The hotel originally opened in 1987 but underwent a complete renovation before it was re-opened in 2005.{{cite web|url=http://www.mandarinoriental.com/about_mo/media/press_kits/singapore/information.aspx |title=Mandarin Oriental, Singapore - General Information |publisher=Mandarinoriental.com |date=2011-06-23 |accessdate=2011-08-10}} ===Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo=== Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo, located from the 37th to 38th floors of the 38-storey Nihonbashi Mitsui Tower, has 178 guestrooms and suites overlooking the [[Tokyo Imperial Palace]] garden to the West and [[Tokyo Bay]] to the Southeast. The hotel operates eight restaurants, a bar, lobby lounge, tea corner and retail cake shop. Among the restaurants is the [[Michelin Guide|Michelin-starred]] Sense, serving modern variations of [[Cantonese]] cuisine.{{cite web|url=http://www.mandarinoriental.com/about_mo/media/press_kits/tokyo/fact_sheet.aspx |title=Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo - Fact Sheet |publisher=Mandarinoriental.com |date=2011-06-23 |accessdate=2011-08-10}} ===Mandarin Oriental, Washington DC=== [[File:Mandarin Oriental in Washington.jpg|thumb||Mandarin Oriental, Washington DC]] Mandarin Oriental, Washington DC, is located in the [[Southwest, Washington, D.C.|SW quadrant]]. Many of the 347 guestrooms and 53 suites feature views of the [[Potomac River]], [[Tidal Basin]], [[Jefferson Memorial]] or [[Washington Monument]]. Eric Ziebold's CityZen, the hotel's main restaurant, is one of the city's best. The more informal CafÃ© MoZU used to be located in the hotel but has since been replaced by SouâWester, which offers Chesapeake- and Southern-inspired fare.{{cite web |title=Sou'Wester Blows Into Town |url=http://www.zagat.com/Blog/Detail.aspx?SNP=NWDC&SCID=41&BLGID=23520 |work=Zagat |date=September 11, 2009 }} ==Under Development== Hotels currently under development are located in [[Abu Dhabi]], [[Beijing]], [[Costa Rica]], [[Dellis Cay]], [[Doha]], [[Grand Cayman]], [[Guangzhou]], [[Maldives]], [[Marbella]], [[Milan]], [[Moscow]], [[Shanghai]], [[St. Kitts]] and [[Taipei]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mandarinoriental.com/about_mo/developments/ |title=Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group -
